{"id":1533930040,"question_id":3643,"lang":"cpp","lang_name":"C++","time":"22 hours, 34 minutes","timestamp":1738866524,"status":10,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"0 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/1533930040/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Zero Array Transformation II","memory":"322.8 MB","code":"class Solution {\npublic:\n    int minZeroArray(vector<int>& nums, vector<vector<int>>& queries) {\n        //queries[i] = [li, ri, vali]. 1 <= vali <= 5\n        //Decrement the value at each index in the range [li, ri] in nums by at most vali.\n        //The amount by which each value is decremented can be chosen independently for each index.\n        //Return the minimum possible non-negative value of k, such that after processing the first k queries in sequence, nums becomes a Zero Array. If no such k exists, return -1.\n        int n = nums.size();\n        int sum = 0;\n        int k = 0;\n        vector<int> cnt(n+1, 0);\n        for(int i=0; i<n; i++) {\n            while(sum+cnt[i] < nums[i]) {\n                if(k==queries.size())\n                    return -1;\n                int l = queries[k][0];\n                int r = queries[k][1];\n                int val = queries[k][2];\n                k++;\n                if(r<i)\n                    continue;\n                cnt[max(l, i)] += val;\n                cnt[r+1]-=val;\n            }\n            sum+= cnt[i];\n        }\n        return k;\n    }\n};","compare_result":"","title_slug":"zero-array-transformation-ii","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
